Posts.Content: On Dec 03, 2016 6:59 PMVaclavik1wrote: On May 06, 2013 8:40 PMjesichashopewrote: You absolutely do not know. There are no guarantees I have found. My daughter gave it all she had and every chemo and radiation was used, it spread nonetheless. Sometimes you have to know in your heart when to switch gears; she did turn to alternative treatments that finally worked. She used to say, what they could not kill in three years with chemo they killed in three weeks with her alternative treatments.  A very happy camper.  What we found was certain cancers are resistant now to chemo but they are not resistant to naturally based treatments.  What it will come down to is what your sister in law wants and what she feels is her right choice.  Let her educate herself on both sides of treatments and then she will know what is best for her. If you google Jesicha's Hope there is lists there and also Jesicha's cancer story it might help. If you need support just holler. Hello I read your post and would love to know more. My husband has stsge4 colon cancer with lung and brain mets. He's on the last chemo they can give him strivarga but we just found out the lesions in his head have grown after radiation. I'm at a loss right now it's been a long three year battle non stop. I love him so much and he doesn't want to die and I don't know what to do to help him. I know there's lots of alternative and natural treatments but with three kids, custody of my little sister and a grandbaby here the cancer has taken all we have. But I'd love to hear more about your daughter! Blessings, Light, and Love, Brandy i am so sorry as to what your husband is going through right now and i really want to help in because my had the same stage four pancreatic cancer which almost took her away from us after a lot of cancer treatment..and that is why i am would love for you to contact doctor allen..he is a good doctor and am glad to refer you to him because he helped my mom and i know he can also help you. please contact him
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body
